wikipedia_page.main: Christopher Beazley (born 5 September 1952) is a British politician who served as a Member of the European Parliament (MEP) from 1984 to 1994 and again from 1999 to 2009. He was member of the Conservative Party until 2019, when he joined the Liberal Democrats.

response: *Christopher Beazley (born 1952), Member of the European Parliament 1984-2009

response: After boundary changes, Beazley was re-elected for Bedfordshire South in the 1984 European Parliament election. At the same election his son Christopher Beazley was elected as MEP for Cornwall and Plymouth. Peter Beazley was put on the powerful Economic and Monetary Affairs and Industrial Policy Committee, and served as vice-chairman from 1984 to 1989. At the 1989 election his majority was cut to 2,977.
*Christopher Beazley MEP (born 1952)BEAZLEY, Christopher John Pridham in Who's Who 2007 (London, A. & C. Black, 2007)

After watching the film, Finnish MEP Ari Vatanen opined: "It is a powerful message. Thank you for telling the truth. It will awaken people." After the premiere in the European parliament, Vatanen stated: "We cannot build a humanity if we close our eyes to this kind of massacres. Our possibility is to serve justice to those people." British MEP Christopher Beazley commented: "This film is very important. It's a very powerful representation of what took place in Poland, in Latvia and the other Central European countries."
* Christopher Beazley, Member of the European Parliament, United Kingdom
